ul.li1: 241 Do not envy men of evil,
ul.li2: and do not desire to be with them.
ul.li1: 2For their minds will devise violence,
ul.li2: and their lips will speak mischief.
ul.li1: 3By wisdom a house is built,
ul.li2: and by understanding it is established.
ul.li1: 4And by knowledge, rooms are filled
ul.li2: with all riches, precious and pleasant.
ul.li1: 5The warrior of wisdom is in strength,
ul.li2: and a man of knowledge is strong in power.
ul.li1: 6For with wise guidance you shall make war for yourself,
ul.li2: and victory is in an abundance of counsel.
ul.li1: 7Wisdom is too high for fools;
ul.li2: at the gate he will not open his mouth.
ul.li1: 8He who plans to do evil forOr “to” himself,
ul.li2: they will call him “masterOr “owner” of mischief.”
ul.li1: 9Devising folly is a sin,
ul.li2: and an abomination to humankind is a scoffer.
ul.li1: 10If you faint on the day of adversity,
ul.li2: little is your strength.
ul.li1: 11Rescue those who are led away to the death
ul.li2: and those who stagger to the slaughter. If you hold back,
ul.li1: 12if you say, “Look, we do not know this,”
ul.li2: does not he who weighs hearts perceive it?
And he who keeps your soul,Or “life,” or “inner self”
he knows and will repay humankind according to his deeds.
ul.li1: 13My child, eat honey, for it is good,
ul.li2: and the dripping of the honeycomb is sweet to your taste.
ul.li1: 14Thus know wisdom for the sake of your soul,Or “life,” or “inner self”
ul.li2: if you find it, then there is a future,
and your hope will not be cut off.
ul.li1: 15Do not lie in wait like an outlaw against the home of the righteous;
ul.li2: do not do violence to his dwelling place.
ul.li1: 16For seven times the righteous will fall, but he will rise,
ul.li2: but the wicked will be overthrown by calamity.
ul.li1: 17While your enemies are falling, do not rejoice;
ul.li2: when he trips himself, may your heartOr “mind” not be glad
ul.li1: 18lest Yahweh see and it be evil in his eyes,
ul.li2: and turn his anger away from him.
ul.li1: 19Do not fret because of the evildoers;
ul.li2: do not envy the wicked.
ul.li1: 20For there will not be a future for the evil;
ul.li2: the lamp of the wicked will die out.
ul.li1: 21Fear Yahweh, my son, and the king;
ul.li2: with those who change, do not associate.
ul.li1: 22For suddenly their disaster will come,
ul.li2: and the ruin of both of them,Literally “the two of them” who knows?
ul.li1: 23These sayings are also for the wise:
ul.li2: PartialityLiterally “acknowledge faces” in judgment is not good.
ul.li1: 24Whoever says to the guilty, “You are righteous,” the people will curse him;
ul.li2: the nations will abhor him.
ul.li1: 25But they who rebuke will have delight,
ul.li2: and upon them blessings of goodness will come.
ul.li1: 26He will kiss the lips,
ul.li2: he who gives an honest answer.
ul.li1: 27Prepare your work in the street and get it ready for yourself in the field;
ul.li2: afterward, thenHebrew “and” you shall build your house.
ul.li1: 28Do not be a witness without cause against your neighbor
ul.li2: nor deceive with your lips.
ul.li1: 29Do not say, “Just as he has done to me, so shall I do to him;
ul.li2: I will pay back the man according to his deed.”
ul.li1: 30I passed by the field of a lazy person,
ul.li2: and over the vineyard of a person lacking sense;Literally “heart”
ul.li1: 31and behold, it was overgrown—all of it was covered with thorns, its surface with nettles,
ul.li2: and its stone wallLiterally “a wall of his/its stones” was broken down.
ul.li1: 32Then I myself saw and my heartOr “mind” considered;
ul.li2: I looked, and I took hold of instruction:
ul.li1: 33A little sleep, a little slumber,
ul.li2: a little folding of the hands for rest,
ul.li1: 34and your poverty will come running,
ul.li2: and your lack like an armed warrior.
